result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Madison R Sturm

records.addlTxt: Deferred Entry of Judgment Order

2:03 PM - case called.  Defendant Madison R Sturm in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin.  Right to counsel.  Responses by Defendant.  Defendant signed a wavier form.  Court finds waiver of an attorney is free and voluntary.  Court questions Defendant regarding preliminary hearing.  Responses by Defendant.  Court finds the waiver of the preliminary hearing is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading.  Plea to Count 1 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Court will withhold the entry of a judgment of conviction.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court notes no victim appears.  Statement by Atty Polzin/Court regarding agreement.  Court approves of the terms and conditions of the DEJ for a period of 18 months.  Court will sign an Order.  Bond will continue during the 18 month DEJ period.

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM - case called.  Defendant Madison R Sturm appeared in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Court reviews Petition for court appointed attorney.  Court questions Defendant.  Responses by Defendant.  Court will now approve the Defendant for a court appointed attorney.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Court questions the Defendant regarding scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
